variable.comment: The total distance run so far, in pixels.
variable.name: TotalDistance

variable.comment: Counts up to 'NextBlock', at which point a new block is created.
variable.name: StartDistance

events.comment: On the start of the game, the camera is set on the X and Y axis so that the outside of the game is not on screen
Wrap the scrolling background infinitely by moving it back after it's scrolled the width of the main image to the left.
Every tick, the camera follows the player and add 200 pixels on the X axis so the border is not visible at the beginning

Once CurrentDistance reaches NextBlock, it is time to create a new block. Create it with a random width and height, then position it just off the right edge of the screen. Make it move to the left again, then set NextBlock to create another block a random distance after this one.
If the player falls off the bottom of the screen, restart the game.
Infinite generation. When the sprite is on-screen, it moves further away while creating a background and a road behind it
Destroy blocks that go off the left of the screen so they don't keep taking up memory or CPU.
Every tick and when the player is moving forward, it increases the score of Total Distance and displays it in the text box
Random enemy spawn event. A random number is picked, spawning its relative object. Objects are then destroyed when player is near them
Everytime the player press A near a monster, the monster lose a life and turns red. If the monster has no life left, it dies.
Everytime the player gets near a monster, a splash text appears telling the player to press A to damage the monster. TO FIX
If the player hit a monster, the player dies and the game retarts
If the player has less than 500 points, the player stays fat
If the player has between 500 and 1000 points, the player becomes slender
If the player has more than 1000 points, the player becomes fit
Max speed for the entire game. If the player has a speed greater than 5000px/s, the game set the speed of the player to 5000px/s
